The Court’s ruling confirms what many legal experts have known for decades – that Roe v. Wade was wrongly decided and the power to set abortion policy should rest with the people and their elected representatives.
This is a momentous day for our nation, and Mississippi led the charge. This decision is an answered prayer, marking the beginning of the next chapter in our fight to protect the unborn.

Today marks the 50th anniversary of Title IX. To ensure female athletes will have equal opportunities for the next 50 and beyond, I have written to the head of the NCAA.

Juneteenth recognizes the end of slavery in our nation. Today is a day to celebrate and recommit to making a better tomorrow for every American. Happy #Juneteenth!

Senator Manchin is once again engaging Democrats on a plan to revive @POTUS’s tax-and-spend bill. I hope he will take a step back from these talks and remember the sound reasons why he rejected the plan in the first place.

https://t.co/EIwIV4DwLp

These voices have gone strangely silent now that their dire predictions have proved false.

Many on the left are now admitting that Democrat spending stoked inflation. The president needs to face reality.
The economy is not working for American families. @POTUS is in the driver’s seat, and it is his responsibility to stall the spending and taxing.

John Melton lost his life at Pearl Harbor. For nearly 80 years, his body could not be identified. Thanks to a recent military initiative, the Liberty, Mississippi native will soon be returned home for a final burial this summer.

With record-breaking gas prices, we should be taking full advantage of our abundant domestic energy resources. Unfortunately, the President continues to wage war on American energy.

We have wage growth at 5.5% but inflation at 8.5%. It's a 3% reduction for every working American. One thing we would do is try to open up oil and gas exploration and development here in the United States where we're blessed beyond measure.

The primary objective of the U.S., its allies, and Taiwan isn’t to repel a Chinese attack but to prevent it from ever occurring. Effective deterrence is the key to national security.

Check out my op-ed with Senator Phil Gramm.

The Supreme Court leak will set a disturbing precedent of inciting mob pressure to intimidate the justices before they issue a decision. For the sake of the court’s independence, this leaker must be found and punished.

Democrats and Republicans should have both denounced the leak. So far, it has only come from our side. Let the Supreme Court interpret the law as it was written by the founding fathers in the Constitution.

I continue to join millions of other Americans in hoping that the Supreme Court will ultimately uphold Mississippi’s law, overturn Roe v. Wade, and return abortion policy to the people and their elected representatives.

“Right now, Title 42 is all that stands between us and an effectively open border.” 

Scrapping Title 42 cannot happen. Our country’s security depends on it.

Free speech is the foundation of our democracy.

Twitter’s track record of censorship has been tilted against conservative voices for some time. I hope an ownership change will spark new respect for promoting free speech at Twitter and that other social media platforms will follow suit.

The Department of Homeland Security is predicting a “historic border surge,” which could triple current migration levels. @ICEgov says it could release up to 600,000 migrants into the U.S. by September, equivalent to the entire Jackson metro area population.

After four years of strict immigration enforcement under President Trump, President Biden has reduced our border to a state of chaos.

https://t.co/en04dTuHre

As we assist the Ukrainian people in their struggle against Russia, we have to appoint a Ukraine Security Assistance Coordinator to oversee the military equipment we are providing. I am supporting this effort to streamline and audit our provisions. https://t.co/6LzNWQU2wI

With prices up 8.5 percent over the past year, Bloomberg estimates that families will have to spend an extra $5,200 for the same goods they purchased last year. This is hardly the recovery Joe Biden promised.

Inflation is a hidden tax on every American. Anyone who buys gasoline or groceries knows it is the biggest issue facing our economy. Since @POTUS cannot deliver real recovery, It now falls to Congress to get control of spending so that inflation can have a chance to settle down.

This infrastructure project is going to help with traffic and make railway movement more efficient through Hattiesburg and the surrounding areas. I was glad to work with Hattiesburg Mayor @toby_barker to see this fantastic project realized.

📷: City of Hattiesburg https://t.co/cBuHP6Rwac

.@POTUS wants to build only nine ships next year while retiring 24. 

Instead of building the Navy needed to secure peace, President Biden’s budget proposal would direct money toward “climate change” initiatives that would do little for the environment.

.@POTUS, this is not a serious defense budget aimed at securing peace through strength. In the coming weeks, I will be pushing Congress to assert its constitutional power of the purse to make sure our security needs are met.

If there was ever a moment for presidential leadership, it is now. The President’s budget proposal would fall especially hard on our Navy fleet, which has been underfunded for years and is now outnumbered by China’s.

Suspending Title 42 would further inflame our Southern border at exactly the wrong moment, @POTUS. Our president has a duty to secure our border, not make matters worse.
Our defense is no small matter, Mr. President. The new defense budget puts a shrinking Navy up against foreign adversaries who have chosen naval growth. https://t.co/f7zls3212f

Judge Jackson has an unusually thin judicial record for someone being appointed to our nation’s highest court. 

Americans should not be left guessing as to how Judge Jackson will do her job as a lifetime member of our highest court. https://t.co/NdTn9rMSXr

Brief as it is, Judge Jackson’s record raises serious red flags. She has not alleviated my concerns that she has a far-left judicial philosophy and would legislate from the bench. I voted “no” on her confirmation.

The TORNADO Act would push the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to begin using storm models that can predict a tornado’s path rather than relying solely on radar detection.

Given the constant threat of tornadoes, this legislation cannot come soon enough.
RT @DJournalnow: "As the lead Republican on the Senate Commerce Committee, I am continuing to advance proposals that will help protect our…

This is how I am advancing proposals that will help protect our communities from extreme weather: https://t.co/XfoyRYs4y3
